column2: In a magocracy, aptitude with the great Art of magic is seen as the primary qualification for rulership.
Arcane spellcasters are the majority of the electors, and those with great arcane talents are favoured for election.
In a commonwealth, all free people can vote, in principle. In practice, this power is often wielded for them by professional politicians.
All free citizens are voters, but in practice their votes are readily bought by politicians. Those who control cities have great electoral sway.
Under Divine Mandate, the favour of the gods determines the right to rule. Those who carry the blood of the gods, or are blessed by them with power, will go far.
Clerics wield the most electoral power, as they are seen as the best judges of the gods' blessing.
[From.GetFirstName]'s deeds are the stuff of legend
A man with tattoos is an unfit ruler
Chosen by a ruler possessed by a powerful spirit
Chosen by an admirably ruthless tyrant
[From.GetFirstName] is possessed by a powerful spirit
[From.GetFirstName] has been greatly blessed by Mystra
The title should remain with the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty
[Root.GetFirstName] is a servant of the gods

The Ordning is the strict code of honor, religion, and culture that permeates all true giant societies. Those low on the Ordning are expected to obey those above them, even so far as different breeds of giant.

An ophidian cabal is a loose term grouping the diverse and insidious serpent kingdoms ruled by the Yuan-Ti, Naga or, more rarely, the Sarrukh. Unified by their caste system, the closer an individual is to the ideal snake form, the higher in rank and power they are.
In the wildlands of Faerun, scale-skinned warriors live in loose tribal societies usually controlled by the strongest or most cunning amongst them.

Monastic Feudal is the broad term for the governments of Toril that center around churches and temples, but maintains military power with feudal barons. This government is typically held by Halflings or Kara-Turans of the Padhran faith. Distinct from Divine governments, which are often led by Clerics and Paladins, Monastic Feudal rules through joint harmony between temporal and spiritual rulers.
column3: Le gouvernement féodal monastique, tout comme le gouvernement féodal ordinaire, repose sur un serment entre le seigneur lige et le vassal, et les seigneurs féodaux monastiques ne peuvent posséder directement que peu de propriétés avant de devoir compter sur les vassaux – dont la fidélité peut varier... Le gouvernement féodal monastique est spécifique aux [tibetan_group.GetGroupName] de confession [buddhist.GetName] ou [bon.GetName] et permet de détenir des temples en plus des châteaux. Les dirigeants féodaux monastiques peuvent également construire des bâtiments du monastère Gompa dans les châteaux.
column4: Wie auch bei der gewöhnlichen Feudalregierung steht im Zentrum eines feudalen Mönchordens der Eid zwischen Lehnsherr und Vasall. Die Anzahl der Besitztümer, die ein feudaler Herrscher persönlich regieren kann, ist begrenzt. Anschließend kommen Vasallen ins Spiel, deren Loyalität unterschiedlich groß sein kann ... der feudale Mönchsorden ist für [tibetan_group.GetGroupName]e Nationen einzigartig, die entweder dem [buddhist.GetName]en oder [bon.GetName]en Glauben angehören und erlaubt das gleichzeitige Halten von Tempeln und Burgen. Herrscher von feudalen Mönchsorden können außerdem in Burg-Besitztümern Gönpa errichten.
column6: El gobierno feudal monástico, como el feudal normal, se articula en torno al pacto entre señor y vasallo. Los señores feudales monásticos solo pueden tener unas cuantas posesiones antes de recurrir a vasallos cuya lealtad puede variar… El gobierno feudal monástico es exclusivo de los [tibetan_group.GetGroupName], ya sean de fe [buddhist.GetName] o [bon.GetName y permite poseer monasterios además de castillos. Los gobernantes feudales monásticos también pueden construir monasterios gompa como edificios en posesiones de castillos.
